text:
When an entity is already cached, and a client sends a request with the Cache-Control: no-cache or no-store header, mod_cache attempts to revalidate the cached content instead of fetching the content from scratch.

This violates RFC2616 14.9.4 Cache Revalidation and Reload Controls:

End-to-end reload
    The request includes a "no-cache" cache-control directive or, for compatibility with HTTP/1.0 clients, "Pragma: no-cache". Field names MUST NOT be included with the no-cache directive in a request. The server MUST NOT use a cached copy when responding to such a request. 

RFC2616 doesn't explicitly state what needs to happen to an existing cached entry when a no-store is received from a client, however in order to honour the client's wishes, a no-store should result in a from scratch request, as opposed to a revalidation of and possible serving of stored content.
